title: Remote Sensing and Cropping Practices: A Review | RTCL.TV

tasks.task: Understand the significance of remote sensing in agriculture.
subtasks: Recognize the role of remote sensing in understanding agriculture.

tasks.task: Review existing literature on remote sensing for mapping cropping practices.
subtasks: Identify the three categories of studies: crop succession, cropping patterns, and cropping techniques.
Acknowledge that most studies are exploratory and local-scale.
Note the reliance on ground data and local knowledge.
Understand the suggestion to use multiple sensors.
Recognize the importance of land stratification.
Note the recommendation for expert knowledge-driven methods.
Understand its potential to improve food security monitoring.
Recognize its role in managing agro-environmental issues.
Identify the authors of the article: Agnes Baig, Damien Arver, Beatriz Bellin, and others.
